overall_impression: It was an easy task to do but harder to do on the robot.
The experiment was clear
It was easy to learn, but moving the arm was more difficult. Generally, it was comfortable to use the system.
It was good. I felt comfortable and it didn't take too much time.
I felt good at being able to teach a robot in such an easy way.
because of the glove , I had the feeling that I am doing something alien! but it was fun and a little painful (maybe because I have a very mild kind of inflammation in my fingers)
It was nice and fast

In the beginning I was using the right arm only. Once this was pointed out, the task became easier after a few iterations. The main difficulties were holding the robotic arm and handling the melon so far from my left hand.
This was my first time participating in such experiments. I enjoyed it.
Very good
very good impression
Very Good
Good! Easy to work with the robot.
It was interesting
there is not enough sufrace on left hand to manipulate the  robot arm
Very cool project! Can't wait to teach robots to do impressive things in the future :-)
This was a fun and engaging experience! Looking forward to skynet! :)
Cool research!
It was interesting
I had some difficulties to use the scoop tool. However I easily controlled the robot.

Great, I found the robotic arm to be very easy to handle and also firm enough to perform the scooping task. Actually I believe it would have been more difficult to use my left hand to handle the melon because I could not have the same grip, strength and stability as the robotic arm.
Somewhat unusual, but ok
The glove and the robot arm were limiting the movements, and they were not felt like real moves I would do with my bare hands
a good tool
The experiment is interesting.
Good
it was difficult to manipulate the robotic arm holding the bowl. I think it could be because my hand was a little small to be able to reach around
Interesting experiment
Good experiment to study the human movements
I liked the robotic arm that holds the position
Very easy and quick experiment to perform.
It was quite hard to direct and apply force to  the robot arm with the melon , as I had to apply much more force than if I would if I had the melon in my left hand.
Interesting
A very interesting experiment!
I have changed the way I hold the scoop over the trial, since I found a hand position in which I can apply higher force
Dont know if it will be useful

I found the task a bit unnatural for me as I had to adapt my movements to the constraints imposed by the kinematics of the robot. Moreover, the weight of the sensors wore on my right arm affected my motions.
it's a bit difficult to scoop because the holding hand is far from the cooping end, which creates a big torque on your wrist when you apply a force with the tool

Having the added distance between where I was holding the robot arm and where the melon was made it harder. I couldn't use both my hands to scoop which lead to me exerting forces in angles which made my arm soar.
The task has generally easy to do but it became even easier when gained more familiarity with the robot
Good
